On Wed, Aug 4, 2010 at 4:07 PM, harpo103 <rmc103@comcast. net> wrote:=



=C2=A0 



Thats a REALY small sample size.
You would likely need severa=
l dozen experimenters to get any solid results. But, nice try anyway.

- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "rasterer" <rasterer@...> wrote:
>
> 



> T=
hanks to everyone who participated in Experiment 3.
> 
> On Friday, 7/30/20=
10 I placed an object on top of my computer monitor, right in front of me, =
and left it there until noon Denver time on Monday, 8/2/2010. This experime=
nt asked for participants to determine what that object was. Vague or parti=
al answers won't be counted (for example, just giving a color, shape, size,=
 what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what it is. Answers anyone reve=
als after noon Denver time Monday won't count. Participants could use their=
 ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other means they chose. 

> 
> In order=
 to keep me honest, I took a picture of the object at the start of the expe=
riment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of this group. The id=
ea with this file is that you could download it at the beginning of the exp=
eriment and 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then at the end of the experim=
ent, I would post the password so you could reveal the contents of the file=
. That way, you were in control of the original image during the entire tim=
e, not me. 

> 
> Passworded pdf: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP=
-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100730. pdf
> 
> The password for that file is: 867530Ni=
eine

> 
> So to the results:
> 
> Number of participants: 2
> Total tries:=
 3
> Ambiguous answers: 0
> Correct answers: 0
> 
> Object: A Pot
> Object =
picture: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100730=
. jpg

> 
> 
> If anyone has any observations, comments, or ideas for impro=
vement, let me know. Again, thanks to everyone who participated in this exp=
eriment.
>
